en: Lennie was just finishing making his bed. The wooden latch raised again and the door opened. A little stocky man stood in the open doorway. He wore blue jean trousers, a flannel shirt, a black, unbuttoned vest and a black coat. His thumbs were stuck in his belt, on each side of a square steel buckle. On his head was a soiled brown Stetson hat, and he wore highâ€“heeled boots and spurs to prove he was not a laboring man.

tn: Maboko a ga George a ne a emisa go dira ka dikarata. Lentswe la hae le ne le futhumetse. 'Re ka nna ra nna le dikgomonyana' - We can have a few pigs "Ke ne ke kgona go aga ntlo ya mosi jaaka e le nngwe ya gran'pa ne, e re ka bolaya kolobe re ka goga bacon le hams, le go dira disoseose tsotlhe tse di tshwanang le tseo. "Fa re ntse re tsamaya, re ne re ka tshwara 1000" go tswa mo lesing le le nang le letswai le le kwa tlase kgotsa go goga. Mme ka ba ne ba setse ba jele sengwe mo mosong, ya bo e le go ja ga sepe. Ga go na sepe se se sa tshwanelang go nna se se siameng jaaka sekerete se se sa tsubegang. Fa ditamati di le teng, di ka nna motlhofo go di dira. Ka Letsatsi la Sontaga re ne re bolaya kgogo kgotsa koko. Gongwe re ka bo re na le kgomo kgotsa podi, mme modimo o tla bo o le mokima mo go wena gore o e fetse ka thipa le go e ntsha ka khaba."

Rehefa mihazakazaka ny salmon dia afaka mahazo sira 'em an' zato 'em an' isika na mifoka 'em'. Azontsika atao ny maka azy ireo ho an'ny sakafo maraina. Tsy misy zavatra mahafinaritra toy ny salmon setroka. Rehefa tonga ny voankazo dia azontsika atao izanyâ€”ary voatabia dia mora ny manao izany. Isaky ny alahady dia mamono akoho na bitro. en: Crooks, the negro stable buck, had his bunk in the harness room; a little shed that leaned off the wall of the barn. On one side of the little room there was a square fourâ€“paned window, and on the other, a narrow plank door leading into the barn. Crooksâ€™ bunk was a long box filled with straw, on which his blankets were flung. On the wall by the window there were pegs on which hung broken harness in process of being mended; strips of new leather; and under the window itself a little bench for leatherâ€“working tools, curved knives and needles and balls of linen thread, and a small hand riveter. On pegs were also pieces of harness, a split collar with the horsehair stuffing sticking out, a broken hame, and a trace chain with its leather covering split. Crooks had his apple box over his bunk, and in it a range of medicine bottles, both for himself and for the horses. There were cans of saddle soap and a drippy can of tar with its paint brush sticking over the edge. And scattered about the floor were a number of personal possessions; for, being alone, Crooks could leave his things about, and being a stable buck and a cripple, he was more permanent than the other men, and he had accumulated more possessions than he could carry on his back.

es: Crooks, el peÃ³n negro, tenÃ­a su camastro en el cuarto de los arneses, un pequeÃ±o cobertizo que sobresalÃ­a de la pared del granero. Bajo la misma ventana, una banqueta para las herramientas de talabarterÃ­a, curvos cuchillos y agujas y ovillos de hebra de hilo, y un pequeÃ±o remachador de mano. Asimismo colgaban de las clavijas fragmentos de arneses, un collarÃ­n roto, que mostraba el relleno de crin, una pechera partida y una cadena de tiro con su forro de cuero tambiÃ©n roto. Crooks tenÃ­a el cajÃ³n de manzanas que le servÃ­a de estante sobre el camastro, y en Ã©l se apilaban gran variedad de frascos de remedios, para Ã©l y para los caballos. HabÃ­a latas de grasa para los arneses y una sucia lata de brea con su pincel asomando por el borde. st: Li-crooks, buck e tsitsitseng e ntÅ¡o, e ne e na le bunk ea hae ka phapusing ea marapo; Ho na le ho hongata hoo ho ileng ha hlaha leboteng la ngoana. Ka lehlakoreng le leng la kamore e nyane ho ne ho e-na le fensetere ea lisekoere tse 'nÃ¨,' me ka lehlakoreng le leng, monyako oa lepolanka o moqotetsane o lebisang ka har'a sethopo. Crooks'bunk e ne e le lebokose le lelelele le neng le tletse lehlokoa, moo likobo tsa hae li neng li flung. Leboteng ka fensetere ho ne ho na le dipeksa tse neng li fanyehiloe marapo a ho robeha ha ho ntse ho mended; Li-strips tsa letlalo tse ncha; Ka tlas'a fensetere ka boeona e le benche e nyane bakeng sa lisebelisoa tsa letlalo tsa li-curve, lithipa tse kobehileng le libolo tsa khoele ea line, le riveter e nyane ea letsoho. Ka pegs ho ne ho boetse ho na le likotoana tsa marapo, molaleng o arohaneng le horsehair stuffing khomarela, e robehileng hame, le ketane trace le letlalo lona koahela split. Crooks e ne e na le lebokose la hae la apole holim'a bunk ea hae, 'me ho eona ho na le libotlolo tsa meriana, ka bobeli bakeng sa hae le bakeng sa lipere. Ho ne ho e-na le sesepa sa saddle le drippy e ka tar ka borashe ba eona ba pente e khomarelang holim'a bohale. 'Me ho ne ho e-na le lintho tse ngata tse neng li e-na le thepa ea botho; Etsoe, kaha o ne a le mong, Crooks ne a ka tlohela lintho tsa hae ka, le ho ba e tsitsitseng buck le holofetseng, o ne a le ka ho sa feleng ho feta banna ba bang, 'me o ne a bokeletseng matlotlo a mangata ho feta kamoo a neng a ka khona ho jara ka morao.

mg: Ny Crooks, ilay ampinga marin-toerana mainty, dia nanana ny fandriany tao amin'ny efitranon'ny harness; Lavaka kely iray izay niankina tamin'ny rindrin'ny trano fisotroana. Teo amin'ny lafiny iray amin'ilay efitrano kely dia nisy varavarankely efa-joro misy lapoaly efamira, ary etsy ankilany, nisy varavarana hazo fisaka tery iray izay mitondra mankany amin'ny trano fitehirizam-bokatra. Ny fandrian'i Crooks dia boaty lava feno mololo, izay niboiboika ny bodofotsy. Teo amin'ny rindrina akaikin'ny varavarankely nisy tsihy izay nihantona tapaka harness eo an-dalam-ho namboarina; 3Notafihin'i Salomona, Etama-SobÃ , ka azony. ary eo ambanin'ny varavarankely dia misy dabilio kely ho an'ny fitaovana vita amin'ny hoditra, antsy sy fanjaitra ary baolina vita amin'ny kofehy rongony, ary tanana kely iray. Teo amin'ny pegs koa dia nisy harness, fehikibo nisaraka tamin'ny volon-tsoavaly nipoaka, hame tapaka, ary rojo iray miaraka amin'ny hoditra voasarona. Nanana ny boaty paomany teo ambonin'ny fandriany i Crooks, ary tao anatiny dia nisy tavoahangy fanafody isan-karazany, na ho an'ny tenany na ho an'ny soavaly. Nisy siny feno savony lasely sy tavoara misy tara misy borosy loko miraikitra eo amin'ny sisiny. Ary niparitaka teo amin' ny tany ny fananan' ny tena manokana maromaro; Fa, satria irery i Crooks dia afaka namela ny fananany, ary noho izy tsy miovaova sy kilemaina, dia naharitra kokoa noho ireo lehilahy hafa izy, ary efa nanangona fananana betsaka kokoa noho izay azony nozakaina.

en: It was very quiet in the barn, and the quiet of the afternoon was on the ranch. Even the clang of the pitched shoes, even the voices of the men in the game seemed to grow more quiet. The air in the barn was dusky in advance of the outside day. A pigeon flew in through the open hay door and circled and flew out again. Around the last stall came a shepherd bitch, lean and long, with heavy, hanging dugs. Halfway to the packing box where the puppies were she caught the dead scent of Curleyâ€™s wife, and the hair rose along her spine. She whimpered and cringed to the packing box, and jumped in among the puppies.

en: Curleyâ€™s wife lay with a halfâ€“covering of yellow hay. And the meanness and the plannings and the discontent and the ache for attention were all gone from her face. She was very pretty and simple, and her face was sweet and young. Now her rouged cheeks and her reddened lips made her seem alive and sleeping very lightly. The curls, tiny little sausages, were spread on the hay behind her head, and her lips were parted.

tn: Mosadi wa ga Moapi o ne a na le halofo e e hibidu e e nang le mmala o o hibidu o o hibidu. Le fa go ntse jalo, go ne go na le dilo tse di sa siamang le tse di neng di le mo tseleng e a neng a di dira ka yone, le fa go ntse jalo, go ne go sa ntse go na le dilo tse a neng a di dira. O ne a le montle thata e bile sefatlhego sa gagwe se le sennye. Mo nakong e e fetileng, go ne ga dira gore mosadi wa gagwe a se ka a mo robatsa a bo a robetse a bo a le moleele thata.
